questions.question: Federigo's love for Monna Giovanna is an example of?

choices.answer: obsession
chivalry
courtly love
unrequitted

questions.question: As a result of his countless efforts to impress Monna, Federigo ends up...

choices.answer: poor
happy
married
dead

questions.question: Monna Giovanna's husband dies and leaves his fortune to...

choices.answer: Monna
her son
Federigo
the falcon

questions.question: When Monna Giovanna's son falls ill, the only thing he wants to make himself feel better is...

choices.answer: a walk in the park
his father comes back
his mother's love
Federigo's Falcon

questions.question: Why does Monna feel bad about asking Federigo for his falcon?

choices.answer: She knows the bird is sick.
She knows her son will kill it.
She feels guilty for not loving him and his fall to poverty.
She secretly hates the falcon.

questions.question: How does Monna compensate Federigo for his suffering and for loving her?

choices.answer: She repays him what he has lost.
She gives him a falcon,
She says she gives him a job.
She lets him cook her and her friend dinner.

questions.question: What does Federigo do to the falcon before Monna has a chance to ask for it?

choices.answer: He kills the bird and serves it as food for dinner.
He lets the bird fly free.
He pawned it for money to buy food.
He already had the bird sent to Monna's son.

questions.question: Why does Federigo serve the Falcon for dinner to Monna Giovanna?

choices.answer: He wanted to surprise her with his best meat.
Monna likes pheasant and he thought falcon would be similar
It broke its wing and couldn't fly anymore anyway.
He is broke and feels it is a proper dinner for Monna.

questions.question: Which type of irony is displayed when Federigo serves the falcon for dinner?

choices.answer: Verbal
Situational
Dramatic
It isn't ironic

questions.question: Why is it drammatic irony when Federigo serves the falcon for dinner?

choices.answer: We don't expect him to cook the falcon.
We know Monna wants the falcon for her son.
Monna wanted him to cook the falcon.
Monna is allergic to falcon.

questions.question: What happens to Monna's son and the inheritance?

choices.answer: He lives and the money is used for his medical expenses.
He dies and the money is left to Monna.
He dies and the inheritance is taken from Monna.
He lives and gives all the money to Federigo.

questions.question: Why does Monna decide to marry Federigo?

choices.answer: They don't want her to be alone.
She needs to provide an heir.
She is young and very rich.
They are afraid Federigo will demand payment.

questions.question: Who does Monna want to marry?

choices.answer: a rich noble and combine their riches.
She refuses to remarry and becomes a rich widow.
her husband's brother so he can have the family money.
She wants to marry Federigo if she can't stay a widow.

questions.question: 10. Why does Monna decide to marry Federigo?

choices.answer: Because of he is noble and honest.
Because she felt sorry for him.
Because she truly loved him.
Because her brothers picked him.

questions.question: Which type of irony is displayed when Federigo ends up with Monna and inheritance?

choices.answer: Verbal
Situational
Dramatic
It is not ironic

questions.question: Which is it situational irony for Federigo to ends up with Monna and her inheritance?

choices.answer: We don't expect the events that led to the marriage or money
We know he cannot give her the falcon.
She cannot ask him for the Falcon.
We don't expect Monna to kill her husband.
